result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Thayer, Anthony Thomas
defendant.address: PO Box 233, 7173 Loon Creek Circle, Danbury, WI 54830

records.addlTxt: Warrant cancelled to amend with a $500 bond.

10:07 AM Defendant Anthony Thomas Thayer not in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Anthony Thomas Thayer.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case was set for return on warrant (voluntary appearance).  Court will amend warrant from body-only to $500 cash.
Return on warrant on October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:13 AM Defendant Anthony Thomas Thayer not in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Anthony Thomas Thayer.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Case was set for status conference.  Court reviews for notice.  State requests warrant.  Atty Chapman stands mute.  Court orders warrant, forfeits cash; forfeiture of cash could be used towards restitution.  Body-only warrant.

1:25 PM Defendant Anthony Thomas Thayer in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Anthony Thomas Thayer.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense indicates it's waiving the prelim.  Case proceeds to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing: Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information.  Atty Chapman notes the WOPH was part of an agreement between the parties.  Case proceeds to  Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 10:45 am.
No contact with the victim or their residence.  The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

3:31 PM Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony Thomas Thayer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Anthony Thomas Thayer.  Def appears from Burnett County Jail; def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Case on for an Initial Appearance and Bail/bond hearing.   Atty Chapman raises issue with probable cause in criminal complaint.  DA Rennicke responds, willing to amend the PC portion of complaint RE: injuries to victim.  Atty Chapman withdraws objection to complaint.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Atty Chapman argues for bond modification, requesting reduction to $500 cash.  State not objecting to modification.  Court amends bond to $500 cash, same conditions.  Def wants prelim within time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:02 PM Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony Thomas Thayer appeared by video, in custody. Def eligible for PD- one is not yet appointed.  Court to adjourn the initial appearance, willing to hear a bond argument if def wishes for her to reconsider bond.  State argues to leave the bond as-is.  Court addresses the defendant.  Def states he can post $1,000 cash.  Court denies the bond modification at this time, resets the initial appearance.  Court willing to hear another bond argument at a later date.  Bond continues.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Initial appearance on August 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
